title: Language, Culture and Identity in India
description:
This module focuses on the relationship

between language, culture and identity in India.

It looks at the roles that languages, cultures, and

literatures play in regional identities in India.

Through case studies of Hindi, Urdu, Gujarati,

Punjabi, Marathi and Bengali it investigates the

significance of language in regional identities. It

also addresses the issue of how language and

culture have been arenas in which contending

notions of Indian identity have been developed.

The module introduces students to the

importance of understanding cultural diversity in

India in relation to the rise of India as a

contemporary world power.
